website_summaries.verdict: The Motorola Moto E5 Plus is a hefty Sprint phablet with a massive 5,000mAh battery that can keep it going for days, but it's too expensive for the specs it offers.

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement should get full refund jeeze
customer_reviews.text: On the date that i purchased this it had an e5 plus photo with all the specifications listed... they were listed like the one on Motorola website... 2 things incorrect though when i looked in system under the hardware information under about phone. It said 2 GB of ram when advertised it was 3 GB ram on store at the time. It also was advertised as 32GB onboard but only has 16 GB onboard memory.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: Said 3 gigabytes of ram it's really 2 flashlight and camera features that is shown on the video do not exist no fast charge ordered gold its silver starting to think it's a fake
customer_reviews.author: Angel Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Little bit of everything but most importantly, a good battery life
customer_reviews.text: I don't dislike anything about it. I got what I paid for basically. I'm 100% happy with it and it's more than I hoped for. The battery life amazes me every day. My old phone was terrible compared to this one and I don't regret a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instruction only come in Spanish -
customer_reviews.text: Instructions only came in Spanish - and I don't read / speak Spanish - this is NOT FUNNY - I have a Traumatic Brain Injury - I have no idea how any of the phone works because I'm trying to figure it out all by myself - never had a smartphone before - this was supposed to make my life easier - reduce stress - make my life safer (more connected / more accessible) - more independent -
customer_reviews.author: Shasta1962

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone. It's slim and very light. I just got the case for it. There's a bit of a learning curve for me as I'm not really techy, yet I've been able to find help online quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: Wise One

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS PHONE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I DONT KNOW WHY I WAITED SO LONG TO GET THIS PHONE...IT IS FANTASTIC...I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget phone with premium performance!
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable phone. I like Android Oreo and Motorola built a solid performer with this phone. Battery performance is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Harred

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality I love the battery
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product I'd love to Quality the only thing I didn't like is the is a little bit heavier than the Galaxy Note
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Motorola E5 Plus
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, perhaps heavier than others but must be quality, love the clock view when you just move the phone without having to press the home or power buttons, excellent battery life and ample memory. I love it. May upgrade to a Motorola G7 Power one day for added memory and stuff..
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Weller

customer_reviews.title: LTE doesn't work properly you have to force it
customer_reviews.text: The LTE don't work very will you have to force it to work every things ither than that perfect. I like the battery and the screen. Alos it's worth what do you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Almetrek

customer_reviews.title: More than fair
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone. Excellent price. Love the phone. I'm on exercise apps and FB and last me all day
customer_reviews.author: dana z.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I brought it because I thought it was Sprint Compatible
customer_reviews.author: Hakim Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Nice screen, buuuut...
customer_reviews.text: 2gb RAM version is a bit choppy. Gold version is cheap looking in person. Loud speaker is just okay, but is front facing so that helps. Spend the extra money for the 3Gb version. 5000mah battery was really good but not awesome. Everyone said the camera was great for the price, eeeh, it was just okay. The big pluses are the screen and battery charges pretty fast for its size.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Kelley

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST PHONE I HAVE HAD
customer_reviews.text: FAST OVERNIGHT FREE SHIPPING. THIS WAS EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED. THIS PHONE IS AWESOME ALL THE WAY AROUND. GREAT FRONT SPEAKER. GREAT SOUND. SUPER FAST FINGERPRINT. AWESOME PHONE. I PAID 170. THE BEST PHONE I HAVE EVER HAD.
customer_reviews.author: renee

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom to replace another smartphone she had for a while. She wanted a phone with a better battery life, was similar to what she had and wouldn't break the bank. I did some research and saw this one. She didn't like that it did not come with headphones. A part from that she is satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rho Main

customer_reviews.title: International Phone
customer_reviews.text: Took it to T Mobile and they determined that the dual SIM model of this phone is not compatible in the States
customer_reviews.author: MarcS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing battery life
customer_reviews.text: The phone has decent speed, with 16GB internal space and does not contain too much bloatware. Unfortunate, I had to return the phone because of inconsistent Bluetooth connection (wearable and Bluetooth dashing cam).
customer_reviews.author: HyTech

customer_reviews.title: Motorola E5 plus phone
customer_reviews.text: I love the battery. Value for money. Fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Matias R.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone with a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: The phone is great the screen is bright enough and sharp enough. The battery lasts a day and a half. The processor is fast and the software is uncluttered. There are a few flaws worth underlining, the Bluetooth seems to disconnect often, the Adaptive brightness doesn't work properly, and the home buttons disappears when you turn on certain apps such as Google News. Overall good value for the money. Specially good if you're looking for something that has a battery that lasts enough throughout the day which was my main concern.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio C. Tavares

customer_reviews.title: Hellow again Motorola
customer_reviews.text: Hellow again Motorola been awhile since i owned one. Razer flip phone still got it and so does the Motorola E5 Plus straight forward software setup 2018 best of the year midrange cellular handset
customer_reviews.author: Devonian Wrighton

customer_reviews.title: perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: the product was perfect for a christmas gift and it worked for metropcs carrier.
customer_reviews.author: luis angel burgos

customer_reviews.title: Samsung who?
customer_reviews.text: So, I paid $900 for a Samsung Galaxy a few years back .... So this phone is better for me. I like it and love the competition in Android.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Moto E Plus (5th Generation) 6.0" Max Vision, Monster 5000mAh Battery, Dual Sim GSM Unlocked International Model, No Warranty XT1924-4 (Gold)
product_meta.description: Built for your best life: Introducing moto e⁵ plus, featuring a 1.5-day battery, a 6” Max Vision display, and a 12 MP camera with laser autofocus, all engineered to fit in a slim design that looks as good as it feels So powerful: With a huge 5000 mAh battery, you get up to 1.5 days of battery life. And when it’s time to power up, don’t slow down. The turbopower charger gives you up to 6 hours of battery life in just 15 minutes of charging. Impressive display: Enjoy a 6" Max Vision display you can use comfortably with just one hand. Do less scrolling on websites. Get a crazy-wide landscape view of games. Even multitask effortlessly on a split screen – if you’re into that sort of thing. Sharp photos: The 12 MP rear camera focuses in an instant with laser autofocus technology and lets in more light with large, 1.25 μm pixels. Turn it around and the 8 MP selfie camera snaps you and your friends in superb lighting, day or night, with the dedicated front flash. Stand out: Designed with a reflective wave pattern and an arched back for a look as great as it feels. On the front, the rounded corner glass panel provides smooth edges, and in the back, the aerial is hidden away.
feature_bullets: 6.0" edge-to-edge HD+ Display, 5000 mAh, Non-removable Battery, Battery life: 1.5 days, Android 8.0, Oreo
ROM: 16GB, RAM: 2GB, Expandable storage microSD Card support (up to 256 GB), Qualcomm Snapdragon 435 processor with 1.4GHz Octa-core CPU and Adreno 505 GPU
Rear camera: 12 MP, f2.0, 1.25um with LED flash, Front camera: 8 MP, f2.2, 1.12um with Selfie Flash/Light, Sensors: Fingerprint reader, Proximity, Accelerometer, Ambient Light, Sensor Hub, Gyroscope

International model phone - NO US WARRANTY. Will work with Most GSM SIM cards in U.S. and world Including AT&T, T-Mobile, MetroPCS, Etc. Will NOT work with CDMA Carriers Such as Verizon, Sprint, Boost.
